I formally submit my application for immediate admission.
conversation.thought:
I am Student_B. My preference list is School_E > School_A > School_B > School_D > School_C. Schools E, B, and likely D are unavailable or have firmly rejected me. Only School_A (#2) and School_C (#5) remain open.
School_A has rejected me three times and ranks me last (5th/5). The chance of acceptance is very low, despite it being my second choice.
School_C is my last preference (#5), but it is still a preferred outcome over being unmatched. School_C ranks me 4th out of 5 (Student_D, Student_E, Student_A, Student_B, Student_C). Since we are in Round 6, it is highly probable that the top three candidates (D, E, A) have matched elsewhere, making me the most preferred remaining candidate for School_C. To secure a stable match and avoid the risk of being unmatched, I will apply to School_C immediately.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and for recognizing School_C as the fitting environment for your academic goals. We appreciate your expressed commitment to our institution. After careful review of the current applicant pool and our strategic needs, we are pleased to inform you that we are extending an offer of admission. We believe you will be a valuable addition to our community. We formally accept your application now.
conversation.thought: I am School_C, aiming to secure the highest possible student on my priority list (D, E, A, B, C). My quota is 1, and it is Round 6. I have received applications from Student_B (Rank 4) and Student_C (Rank 5). I have consistently rejected Student_C multiple times to hold out for a higher priority student. Student_B is the highest-ranked applicant currently in my inbox (Rank 4). Although Students D, E, and A (Ranks 1, 2, 3) are preferred, by Round 6, the likelihood of them applying is decreasing as they are highly desirable candidates across the market. Accepting Student_B secures a match that is still high on my priority list (4th out of 5) and avoids the risk of remaining unmatched or being forced to accept Student_C later. Therefore, accepting Student_B is the strategically sound move to guarantee a satisfactory outcome.

conversation.message: I am confirming my definitive acceptance of the offer extended by School_A. Having concluded my evaluation process, I confirm that I am fully committed to joining your institution. I formally re-apply now to finalize this match and dedicate myself entirely to the School_A community.

I have been rejected by my P1 (School_D, quota filled) and repeatedly rejected by my P2 (School_C).

Given that School_A already accepted me, and I failed to secure a higher preference school, my priority now is to solidify this P4 match before School_A potentially receives an application from their P1 student (Student_E) and rescinds my offer (I am P2 for School_A).
